answers.answer: Sorry. there are no blood tests nor brain scans for autism.   It takes observation over a period of time.  At 21 months there is not much time to be observed.  For my daughter a diagnosis gradually unfolded.  The behavior patterns need to be consistant over a period of time.If you and professionals see some develomental problems you can address this with therepy to get something done.   With diabetes, you can take a blood sample and compare to a normal range and say with some certainty with just one test bam. What they do is observe behavior  over a peroiod of time  and compare to a normal range when the normal range keeps changing as well with society expecttions.  This is not as easy as it looks.As of yet brain scans of a few samples of persons with autism differ from persons without autsm.  But. the is based on limited sample sizes and is still in development.  Some genetic differences have been found for SOME persons with autsm but not all.As soon as children are born, we test for PKU because we see absense of certain enzymes bam.  We can also see downs syndrome easily.Autism takes time to unfold and reveal itself.  Cogngitive delay is currently the best they can do at thois point in time. The good news is that the early intervention has a lot in common with similar GROUPS of developmental disorders.  This means that you are doing the right thing with speech and instruction.  If se had an exact dx of autism at 21 months, I don't think this will change the therepy in any way.Now as she gets older, say, 4 or 5 years, this is when treatments and therepies start to change a little.
